sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today the United Kingdom lays rest to Queen Elizabeth II, as her state funeral began earlier in London in what is an historic day for the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Her body was led from Westminster Hall in the state gun carriage by the Royal Navy and Royal Marines and accompanied by the drums and pipes of the Scottish and Irish regiments to Westminster Abbey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As part of the procession, her coffin was followed by senior members of the Royal Family, including the new King Charles III and his can carry on and save the world. and her commitment to the causes she held dear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The funeral procession was led by the Dean of Westminster and was followed by lessons read by Liz Truss, the newly appointed Prime Minister and the Secretary General of the Commonwealth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The service ended at 11.55 local time and was followed by a two minute silence around the country. Queen Elizabeth II led the monarchy for 70 years and she died at the age of 96.
